page.title: 05CAMBRIDGESHIRE WATER SUPPLY
page.content: The building looks like a church and is about ten metres high. Inside it is very noisey where the machinery is. It is extremely clean. The building is high because the pump used to be operated by steam. There is still a large pond which was used for cooling. It is now full of tadpoles and some fairly large fish.There are also very pleasant grounds. It pumps water from quite deep underground and there is a stand-by pump for emergencies. Most of the water is sent to Cambridge. The plant may soon close but if it does it may need two stations to replace it because of increasing demand for water in the area. It is the last manned pumping station in Cambridgeshire.
